epics.title: Entity Model v2
epics.description: Complete rewrite of data model, types, store, routes, tools, and UI
epics.ai_summary: Entity model v2 refactor complete. 14 entity types defined, data migrated, store rewritten, 7 new route files, AI tools updated, UI overhauled. Foundation for enterprise-grade PM.

epics.title: AI Intelligence Engine
epics.description: The core AI product: chat agent with full tool access, multi-provider model routing, memory/caching, and eventually background agents. This is the engine that makes DevTrack intelligent.
epics.ai_summary: Weekly refresh: Rate limiting shipped and validated. Chat agent proven (session 9 investigation + handoff pattern). User profiles shipped. Docs generation system production-ready (session 10). Remaining: AI memory cache (P1 Next), multi-model budgeting (P2 Later), background agents (P3 Later). Core intelligence layer is functional and battle-tested. ISS-043 (prompt caching) is the biggest optimization opportunity — 90% cost savings available.

epics.title: Automation & Self-Healing
epics.description: DevTrack manages itself: file watcher, session lifecycle, self-audits, automation engine hardening. The system that ensures nothing falls through the cracks.
epics.ai_summary: Weekly refresh: Session self-audit shipped and validated (sessions 8-9). Automation engine operational (28+ audit runs). ISS-034 (semantic file watcher) remains CRITICAL BLOCKER — prevents reliable triggers from external edits. Session 11 infrastructure work (change-queue.ts, hooks.ts) may be addressing this. Once ISS-034 resolved, self-healing system will be complete. Brain note dedup, headless logging, session lifecycle all in Next horizon.

epics.title: UI & Views
epics.description: Everything the user sees: design polish, new views (analytics, activity log), global search, view modes. Linear-inspired aesthetic with clean information density.
epics.ai_summary: 5/7 shipped: boot-ui, kanban dnd, automation settings, rich tool tray, activity log. Remaining: global search, UI design overhaul phase 2. Analytics dashboard in backlog.

epics.title: Data Integrity & Trust
epics.description: Knowing who did what: entity provenance (User/DevTrack AI/External attribution), data archival, audit trails. The foundation for trusting AI-managed data.
epics.ai_summary: Not started. Entity provenance (three-label attribution) and smart archival system both pending. Activity log exists but provenance badges are placeholder.

epics.title: Platform & Distribution
epics.description: Making DevTrack a product: CLI tooling, project initialization, context sync across AI platforms, and eventually paid product launch with daemon + web platform.
epics.ai_summary: Weekly refresh: Multi-user prep COMPLETE (session 10). TypeScript build clean. CLI remains degraded (50%) — never tested against live server, 14+ days stale. ISS-003 (integration testing) open 14+ days, blocks full dogfooding. Init wizard in Later. Context sync CLI in Later. Paid product launch far future. Critical path: validate CLI, resolve ISS-003, then dogfood on Landmark.

epics.title: Codebase Intelligence
epics.description: Understanding the code: living wiki docs, auto-generated documentation, structured annotations, codebase visualization improvements.
epics.ai_summary: Weekly refresh: Docs generation system COMPLETE and production-ready (session 10). $50 invested, 14 docs generated. Discovery agent + per-doc writers + 4-layer framework + parallel execution + verification + recovery + three-column UI + Mermaid + sub-pages + provenance tracking. Architecture graph has layman descriptions. Only remaining: structured code annotations (P3 Later). This epic is essentially done.

epics.title: Automation Audits - Full Transparency into AI Operations
epics.description: End-to-end audit system: data capture pipeline that records every step of automation runs (thinking chain, tool calls, changes, suggestions, cost), persistent storage with indexing, API routes, rich UI with filters/detail/analytics, and suggestion approval workflow.
epics.ai_summary: Complete. All 8 items shipped in session 9: data model, storage layer, AuditRecorder, engine wiring, API routes, UI view, AI tools, plus parent audits-tab. Full transparency into automation operations. Audit system validated — session-end-audit ran successfully, change-tracker ran successfully, weekly-report ran successfully.
